channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV's time in Peru offers a glimpse into his immigration views
item.description: Pope Leo XIV's time as bishop in a small Peruvian city offers the clearest glimpse into his views on immigration.

item.title: Worried about disaster preparedness? Life Kit has tips on how to start a 'go bag'
item.description: As climate emergencies like wildfires and hurricanes become more prevalent, it's important to have essentials like food and medicine on hand and ready to go in case you need to evacuate.

item.title: 5 years since George Floyd's death, what's happened to police overhaul efforts?
item.description: Five years since George Floyd's murder, the energy around overhauling policing has evaporated.Â Critics say pro-police messaging stifles attempts to address the problems in policing.

item.title: Looking to grill more veggies this Memorial Day? Try nopales
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with food writer Maria Melendez Ayala about nopales, edible cactus plants that are a staple in Mexican cuisine.

item.title: Nina Totenberg reflects on what it's like to cover the Supreme Court
item.description: For decades, Nina Totenberg has brought us some of the most notable and memorable reporting on the Supreme Court. Today, she takes us behind the scenes of what it's like to cover the Third Branch.

item.title: Rural library funding threats
item.description: For years, the Institute of Museum and Library Services has supported rural libraries. However, cuts by the Trump administration could jeopardize their future.

item.title: The battle to protect Europe's wolves
item.description: The EU is trying to downgrade the protection status of wolves in Europe. Scientists say there are many ways to co-exist with these creatures that are vital for a healthy ecosystem.

item.title: Trump's massive spending bill & the GOP's priorities
item.description: House Republicans muscled through President Trump's massive tax and spending bill this week. The vote this week sends a clear message about where the Republican party is today.

item.title: Indian writer Banu Mushtaq wins International Booker Prize
item.description: Joy in India as writer Banu Mushtaq wins a major literary award for her short stories that she wrote over 3 decades in a regional language.

item.title: How do once fringe, right-wing theories make their to the White House?
item.description: On the heels of President Trump promoting misinformation about a white genocide in South Africa, we take a look at how once fringe theories make their way to the White House.
